component_title_copy.jcr:title: What is a personal loan Pre-Payment Calculator

about_product_text_c.text: Do you have an unexpected cash inflow and don't have plans to use it? Why not pay off your personal loan? Tata Capital allows you to prepay your personal loans even before the loan tenure ends. You can prepay your personal loan in part or full depending on your preference.

instant_loan_box_cop_121566203.text: You can use the personal loan pre-payment calculator by following the steps mentioned below and calculating the loan pre-closure charges–

container-main.className: instant-personal-slider tab-no-flex flex-slider slider-arrows slider-dots jsInstantPerSlider

instant_loan_box_car.jcr:title: Use the ‘Loan Amount’ slider to set the pre-payment calculator personal loan amount

text.jcr:title: Enter Name, Mobile Number and verify with PAN number

instant_loan_box_tex.jcr:title: Use the ‘Loan Amount’ slider to set the pre-payment calculator personal loan amount

text.jcr:title: Enter Name, Mobile Number and verify with PAN number

instant_loan_box_tex.jcr:title: Use the ‘Tenure’ slider to choose the loan tenure, either in months or years

text.jcr:title: Enter Name, Mobile Number and verify with PAN number

instant_loan_box_tex.jcr:title: Use the ‘Rate of Interest’ slider to set the desired interest rate in the pre-payment calculator personal loan.

text.jcr:title: Enter Name, Mobile Number and verify with PAN number

instant_loan_box_tex.jcr:title: Using the next slider, choose the ‘Part Prepayment of Personal Loan Amount.’

text.jcr:title: Enter Name, Mobile Number and verify with PAN number

instant_loan_box_tex.jcr:title: This slider will help you select the payment months or years. The calculator will automatically display the EMI and the Revised Tenure

heading.jcr:title: How to use a Personal LoanPre-Payment Calculator under 5 minutes

text.text: Note: You can either use the ‘+’ or ‘-‘ symbols to increase or decrease the amount. Alternatively, you can even enter the amount manually in a box

item_1671182759452.cq:panelTitle: What do you mean by pre-payment of a personal loan?

text.text: Personal loan can be availed by those who meet the following eligibility criteria:

popular_faq_descript_200750825.jcr:title: Monthly Income–must be at least Rs. 15,000 per month.

popular_faq_descript_1717367127.jcr:title: Job Stability–The applicant must be in the same job for the past six months.

popular_faq_descript_1283418988.jcr:title: Work Experience–The applicant must have a minimum of one year of work experience.

item_1671182794032.cq:panelTitle: Are there any personal loan foreclosure charges?

text.text: The documents needed to avail of a personal loan depend on the purpose of your loan. For example,

item_1671182842904.cq:panelTitle: Should you pre-pay your personal loan?

text.text: The following are documents required for personal loan eligibility by self-employed individuals –

popular_faq_descript.jcr:title: Proof of Existence of Business–Tax Registration copy/Company Registration License/Shop Establishment Proof

popular_faq_descript_2140895260.jcr:title: Identity Proof documents–Passport/Voter’s ID/PAN Card/Driving Licens

popular_faq_descript_238767962.jcr:title: Residence Proof documents–Passport/Aadhar Card/Utility Bill/Ration Card

popular_faq_descript_1398810579.jcr:title: Bank Account Statements–Savings and Current account statements for the past one year

popular_faq_descript_48870029.jcr:title: Income Tax Returns filed for the preceding year

item_1671182856999.cq:panelTitle: How to use Tata Capital’s personal loan pre-payment calculator?

text.text: A self-employed person can get a personal loan with Tata Capital by meeting the following eligibility criteria –

popular_faq_descript.jcr:title: The applicant’s age must be between 22 to 58 years

popular_faq_descript_1530875188.jcr:title: The applicant must have a monthly income of at least Rs.15,000

popular_faq_descript_211221741.jcr:title: The applicant must have at least one year of work experience

item_1671123079130.jcr:description:
Want to fund your vacation but falling short on funds? An EMI based loan can be an ideal way to pay for a holiday that you can’t quite cover in one go.

Tata Capital Personal Loan for Travel is how you can make it happen. Head off on your next adventure.
